articles.title: FEBRUARY, 1971
articles.summary: This document lists the officers for the month of February 1971. It includes the President, Vice-President, Secretary, and Treasurer, along with their names and phone numbers.

articles.title: BOARD MEMBERS
articles.summary: This document lists the board members and other key personnel for the San Jose Amateur Astronomers for the terms 1969-1971 and 1970-1972. It also welcomes new members for 1971, highlighting upcoming events such as star parties and lectures, and encourages active member participation and the exchange of ideas.

articles.title: FEBRUARY MEETING - Amateur Speaker
articles.summary: The club's February meeting will take place on Friday, February 5th, at Community Bank. Bruce Smith is scheduled to speak on "Variations in the earth's magnetic field and its relationship to earthquakes," utilizing slides for his presentation. The meeting will also feature the club's library slides and Dr. Gregory's slides from the WAA convention held last August.

articles.title: STAR PARTY - Saturday, January 30 at Dusk, at LCO-Observatory site
articles.summary: A Star Party is scheduled for Saturday, January 30, at dusk, to be held at the LCO-Observatory site. Participants will have the opportunity to observe various Messier objects, including M79, M38, M1, and M42. Attendees can contact Dave for directions or ride arrangements.

articles.title: PLANNING MEETING - Friday, February 12, 8 p.m.
articles.summary: This document announces a planning meeting for the San Jose Amateur Astronomers on Friday, February 12, at Bruce Smith's residence to discuss observatory work parties. It also informs members of an upcoming increase in annual membership dues to $10.00, starting in June, due to increased Sky and Telescope rates. The bulletin submission process and immediate material needs for the observatory roof are also detailed, along with a couple of 'for sale' listings for astronomical equipment.

articles.title: MID-YEAR NEW MEMBERS (complete membership list will appear in Aug)
articles.summary: This document lists nine new members joining the organization mid-year, providing their names, addresses, and phone numbers. It also includes one change of address for an existing member. A complete membership list is noted to appear in August.

articles.title: Culmination for Messier Objects - 10 p.m. Local Mean Time
articles.summary: This document provides a schedule for the culmination of various Messier objects at 10 p.m. Local Mean Time for specific dates in January. It lists each object, its classification (e.g., Globular Cluster, Gaseous Nebula, Galactic Cluster, Planetary Nebula, Galaxy), and its visual magnitude where available. The table serves as a guide for observers interested in tracking deep-sky objects.

articles.title: FEBRUARY
articles.summary: This document, titled "FEBRUARY," presents a schedule or list of celestial objects for observation during the month. It details specific Messier objects, primarily galactic clusters like M41, M50, and M47, with corresponding dates throughout February.

articles.title: SIDERAL TIME CONVERSION CHART FOR FEBRUARY
articles.summary: This document provides a sidereal time conversion chart for each day of February, calibrated for 8 p.m. PST at 120Â° west longitude. It includes instructions for adjusting the listed times to calculate sidereal time for San Jose by subtracting 7 minutes and for times beyond 8 p.m. by adding 30 seconds for every two hours elapsed.

articles.title: LATE WINTER AND SPRING CALENDAR
articles.summary: This document outlines a calendar of events for late winter and spring, spanning from January to June. It details various club activities including regular meetings with potential speakers or films, planning meetings held at members' homes, and multiple star parties at LCO-observatory sites and other locations. Several dates also include observatory work parties to maintain facilities.
